description: Early childhood education (ECE) is a key focus area for India as it aims to become a developed country by 2047, according to Niti Aayog CEO BVR Subrahmanyan. He emphasized the urgency, noting that most of the future workforce, who will contribute to India's growth, is already born and needs quality education. Subrahmanyan highlighted ECE as a top priority area discussed in a presentation to Prime Minister Narendra Modi.
title: Childhood education key as India aims to be 'developed' by 2047

description: Barely 24 hours after Friday's alleged gang-rape of a Spanish tourist in Jharkhand's Dumka, an orchestra troupe member from Chhattisgarh was assaulted by three men in Jharkhand's Palamu district late Saturday, reports MF Ahmad. According to the FIR filed on Sunday with Palamu's Bishrampur police, the perpetrators were known to the survivor.
title: After Spanish shocker, C’garh orchestra member raped in J’khand

description: A 7-judge bench, in overturning a 26-year-old Supreme Court judgment in the P V Narasimha Rao case, declared that the previous decision was based on a misguided interpretation of the laws governing freedom of speech in both the United Kingdom and India, and noted that in the last two decades even UK SC has allowed prosecution of corrupt elected representatives.
title: Wrong take on UK law led to faulty order: Supreme Court
Delhi HC exempts customs levies on rare disease drugs

description: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Monday, announced the attachment of assets valued at Rs 46 lakh belonging to Zakir Husain Memorial Trust in Farrukhabad (UP). This action is part of a money laundering case against Louis Khurshid, the wife of former law minister and Congress leader Salman Khurshid, along with her associates.
title: ED attaches Rs 46L assets in Cong minister Khurshid's wife case

description: All "political orders" passed by Justice Abhijit Gangopadhyay in school service commission cases should be struck down, senior advocate and Trinamool Lok Sabha MP Kalyan Banerjee pleaded before the Calcutta HC bench hearing alleged school recruitment scam-related cases on Monday. Banerjee, who was arguing for school job seekers, told the bench that Justice Gangopadhyay was a "political person" and the orders he had authored were done with "a political motive".
title: All 'political orders' of Gangopadhyay should be set aside: TMC MP

description: Delhi HC on Monday issued a notice to Centre on plea by French journalist Vanessa Dougnac against her being denied permission to carry out ‘journalistic activities’ in India. Single judge bench of Justice Subramonium Prasad sought Centre’s response through ministries of home affairs and external affairs in a week. The matter will be heard on March 12.
title: Delhi HC notice to Centre in French journo OCI case

description: Allahabad high court has directed a Varanasi court to decide, "preferably within eight weeks", a petition seeking unrestricted right to worship the purported Shivling found inside Gyanvapi mosque premises in May 2022. This application was filed before Varanasi's civil judge (senior division) in a petition seeking a permanent injunction against Anjuman Intezamia Masjid (AIM) restraining it from interfering in worship of Shivling.
title: Decide in 8 weeks plea for Gyanvapi 'Shivling' puja: Allahabad HC

description: Home Minister Amit Shah assured representatives from Leh and Kargil that the Modi government is committed to providing necessary constitutional safeguards for the Union Territory (UT) of Ladakh. A sub-committee engaged with the Ministry of Law and other experts is actively working on the constitutional safeguards. The meeting addressed various issues related to land, employment, and constitutional safeguards for the benefit of the people of Ladakh.
title: Shah: Centre firm on providing constitutional safeguards to Ladakh

description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi's statement that 140 crore Indians are his family has sparked a 'Modi Ka Parivar' campaign by top BJP leaders in response to Lalu Prasad's remark that Modi has no family. Home Minister Amit Shah, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh, BJP President JP Nadda, and others appended 'Modi Ka Parivar' to their social media profiles, showing solidarity with the PM.
title: BJP launches ‘Modi ka parivar’ campaign to counter Lalu’s jibe

description: Deductions like provident fund contribution, festival advance, LIC premium, house rent recovery and loan cannot be factored in while assessing maintenance amount to be paid by a husband seeking divorce, Karnataka HC ruled. These deductions accrue only to benefit of the petitioner, Justice Hanchate Sanjeevkumar said, dismissing a petition filed by a SBI employee as "devoid of merit".
title: Take-home salary can't be basis for computing maintenance: HC

description: RBI governor Shaktikanta Das said the central bank has approved a platform that will facilitate online merchants to receive payments from any bank via internet banking, without signing up for every bank. Bharat Bill Payment System, an arm of the National Payments Corporation of India, will implement a new system of interoperable netbanking payments.
title: RBI clears 'interoperable' net banking payments

description: Tata Group, India's top conglomerate, plans to split its automobile business into two separate listed entities. The commercial vehicle unit will be separated from the passenger vehicle arm, which includes the profitable Jaguar Land Rover. Following this move, the group will have four automotive entities listed on the stock exchange.
title: Tata Motors to split cars, commercial vehicles business
1st time since '77, no member of RLD's first family in LS fray

description: Svatantra Microfin, founded and chaired by Ananya Birla, has reached a definitive agreement with Advent International and Multiples for a Rs 1,930 crore ($230 million) investment. This is the largest private equity investment in India's microfinance sector. Following Svatantra's recent acquisition of Chaitanya India Fin Credit from Sachin Bansal, the combined entity will become one of India's largest non-banking microfinance companies.
title: Ananya Birla's microfin co to net Rs 1.9k cr in sector's biggest funding

description: The Shiv Sena, led by Eknath Shinde, has increased its demand for Lok Sabha seats in Maharashtra, asking for 22 out of the 48 constituencies in the upcoming elections. Sena minister Shambhuraj Desai stated that his party insists on receiving the same number of seats as in the 2019 elections.
title: Shinde Sena ups demand, seeks 22 of 48 Maharashtra seats

description: Five-time MLA Tapas Roy has resigned from all his positions within the Trinamool Congress (TMC) and the assembly, dealing a blow to the party ahead of the Lok Sabha polls in West Bengal. Roy cited feeling "hurt and insulted" at not receiving support from TMC leaders following an ED raid on his home.
title: Jolt to TMC as 5-time MLA Tapas Roy quits party

description: After 6 Congress MLAs were disqualified, now 7 BJP MLAs are likely to face action for creating ruckus in Himachal assembly. Speaker suspended 15 BJP MLAs during Budget session. Privilege committee proceedings have started. MLAs are asked to reply within 10 days. State PWD minister met rebel MLAs after the Rajya Sabha polls.
title: Himachal BJP fears 7 of its MLAs may be expelled

description: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi accused PM Narendra Modi of lacking the intent to provide jobs to the youth and pledged that the INDIA alliance, if voted , will fill around 10 lakh vacancies in central government departments that have accumulated over the last ten years. Rahul Gandhi questioned why 30% of posts in 15 major departments remain vacant.
title: Congress manifesto may vow ‘right to apprenticeship’
3 arrested for pro-Pakistan chants in Karnataka House

description: A Rs 11,793-crore human hair smuggling racket has been uncovered with a complex money trail and alleged money laundering through a Hyderabad-Mizoram-Myanmar corridor. The ED had initiated action against Hyderabad-based Nayla Family Exports Private Ltd in 2021 for using benami import-export codes, impersonation, and forgery in connection with the racket.
title: As China battles baldness, ED unearths Rs 11,793 crore hair racket
Lock up opposition MLAs, Punjab CM Mann tells speaker

description: Startups, which were impacted by Google's delisting over dispute on payment systems and fee, met IT minister Ashwini Vaishnaw and minister of state Rajeev Chandrasekhar on Monday and apprised them of "challenges and potential threat to business sustainability and operations" due to the sudden measure undertaken by the US tech giant last week.
title: Google delisting: Startups meet government, say it's battle for survival

description: RBI on Monday ordered IIFL Finance to "cease and desist" from sanctioning or disbursing gold loans with immediate effect citing multiple "regulatory violations". The drastic action comes on the back of RBI finding irregularities during supervision, where the company appeared to be granting more loans than what the security permitted.
title: RBI bars IIFL Finance from disbursing gold loans

description: State-run fuel retailers in India are replacing existing hoardings of central welfare schemes at petrol pumps with new ones featuring the slogan "Modi's guarantee means a better life." The move is a play on the BJP's poll slogan 'Modi ki Guarantee' and showcases a photo of the Prime Minister handing over an LPG cylinder to a beneficiary of the 'Ujjwala' scheme.
title: 'Modi ki guarantee' hoardings at pumps, govt 'nudges' state retailers

description: The Supreme Court ruled that voting in RS poll forms part of the privileges and immunities enjoyed by the House and its members. The court underlined the importance of protection given to MLAs to ensure they vote in RS elections without fear or legal prosecution for the dignity and functioning of the state assembly.
title: President, VP, RS vote part of House proceeding, says SC but Sita Soren not yet out of woods

description: Supreme Court ruled that MPs and MLAs cannot claim privileges and immunities unrelated to functioning of the House. The decision overruled a 1998 judgment and emphasized that lawmakers are subject to the same laws as the people they represent.
title: MP, MLA privileges, immunity tied to House functioning: SC

description: Four people died on the spot and three others were injured early Monday morning when the private taxi they were travelling in plunged into a gorge in Ramban district of Jammu & Kashmir, police said. District administration released Rs 1 lakh ex-gratia to next of kin of the deceased and Rs 50,000 to the injured.
title: 4 killed, 3 injured as private taxi falls into gorge in Jammu & Kashmir
Diagnosed with cancer on Aditya-L1 launch day, cured now: Isro chief

description: A second man has been charged with the murder of Indian restaurant manager Vignesh Raman in Reading. Soiheem Hussain (27) of Rossby, Shinfield, appeared at Reading crown court on Monday charged with one count of murder in connection with the death of Vignesh Pattabi Raman (36), manager of South Indian restaurant Vel.
title: Second man charged with murder of Coimbatore restaurateur in UK
Army jawan killed in accidental firing in J&K’s Rajouri

description: The French parliament voted on Monday to include the right to abortion in the country's constitution, making it the first nation to provide explicit protection for terminating pregnancies in its basic law. ​​Both the lower and upper houses of parliament, gathered at the Palace of Versailles, easily obtained the three-fifths majority required for the change, with 72 lawmakers voting against.
title: French lawmakers votes to make abortion constitutional right

description: Royal Challengers Bangalore defeated UP Warriorz by 23 runs in the Women's Premier League on Monday. Skipper Smriti Mandhana (80) and Ellyse Perry (58) scored blistering fifties to take RCB to 198 for 3. The two added 95 runs off just 64 balls for the second wicket. The RCB bowlers then fired as a unit, taking wickets at regular intervals to restrict the Warriorz to 175 for 8 despite the best efforts of skipper Alyssa Healy (55), allrounder Deepti Sharma (33) and Poonam Khemnar (31).
title: WPL: Mandhana, Perry star in RCB's 23-run win over UP
'Carl-Gustaf weapons system to be built in India from next year'

description: Ellyse Perry's powerful six during RCB vs UP Warriorz Women's Premier League match shattered the rear car window. Perry scored 58 runs in 37 balls to power RCB to 198 for 3. Skipper Smriti Mandhana also scored a cracking 50-ball 80 after Warriorz opted to bowl.
title: Watch: Perry demolishes car window during WPL match

description: SBI asks for more time to disclose Electoral Bond details as Rahul Gandhi questions secrecy before elections. SC Constitution bench remarks on right to know truth about bonds. Gandhi says black pulses show nothing black.
title: 'Donation business': Rahul slams PM over poll bonds case

description: Google Gemini's image generation criticized for inaccuracies and biases. Co-founders admit to 'messing up'. IT minister calls it a violation of IT laws. Google works to address the issue of unreliable responses to certain prompts. IT minister Rajeev Chandrasekhar dubbed “the episode of Google Gemini” as “very embarrassing” and said that the government considers this a violation of IT laws.
title: 'Definitely messed up': Google co-founder Gemini image generation

description: Defence Minister and Indian Navy commanders review maritime security on INS Vikrant and INS Vikramaditya. Conference emphasizes tri-service synergy, strategic clarity, and India's responsibility as a maritime power. Twin carrier operations showcased. Institutionalized framework ensures government interaction.
title: Defence minister Rajnath Singh to review India's maritime security
US top court restores Trump on Colorado ballot
BJP chief JP Nadda resigns as Rajya Sabha member

description: The Bengaluru Police have arrested three individuals for chanting pro-Pakistan slogans at the Karnataka Vidhana Soudha. The incident occurred after the BJP claimed that supporters of Congress leader Dr Syed Naseer Hussain had chanted such slogans. A scientific report by Clue4 Evidence Forensic Investigations Private Limited supports the BJP's claim.
title: 3 held for pro-Pak slogans in K'taka assembly

description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi addressed a public meeting in Chennai, Tamil Nadu. He responded to opposition remarks, criticized the DMK government, highlighted the SC's tough questions, and emphasized the mission to develop Tamil Nadu and India.
title: 'INDIA bloc has new formula ...': PM Modi mocks oppn in Chennai

description: A sharp mind with a penchant for trying out new things, senior off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin is relentless in his bowling approach and always tries to keep himself one step ahead of opposition batters, his long-time national team-mate Cheteshwar Pujara said.
title: Pujara reveals Ashwin's success mantra

description: The State Bank of India (SBI) has requested the Supreme Court to extend the deadline till June 30 for disclosing electoral bonds information to the Election Commission. The apex court annulled the scheme and ordered SBI to disclose contributors' details by March 6 and publish the date on its website by March 13.
title: SBI seeks 3 more months to furnish electoral bonds data to poll panel

description: The Enforcement Directorate has issued fresh summons to Trinamool Congress leader and former Lok Sabha MP Mahua Moitra for questioning in a FEMA contravention case on March 11, official sources said on Monday. The 49-year-old politician had sought a few weeks time to join the investigation and sent a communication to the agency expressing her inability to depose before it last month, they said.
title: ED summons Mahua again in FEMA case

description: Apple unveils new MacBook Air models powered by M3 chip, promising significant performance boost, improved battery life, AI capabilities, Liquid Retina display, Wi-Fi 6E support, environmental sustainability, availability starting March 8, prices start at Rs 114,900. M1 MacBook Air discontinued.
title: Apple launches 13-inch, 15-inch MacBook Air with M3 chip

description: Rashtriya Lok Dal (RLD) released its list of Lok Sabha election candidates, including Chandan Chauhan and Dr Rajkumar Sangwan. Jayant Chaudhary's absence raised eyebrows. RLD joined national Democratic alliance under PM Modi's leadership.
title: LS polls: RLD releases 1st list, Jayant's name missing

description: The European Union fined Apple a record 1.8 billion euros for abusing its dominant position in the music streaming market. Apple's App Store rules restricted competition. The EU's Digital Markets Act promotes fair competition. Apple faces legal challenges and antitrust lawsuits over its restrictive policies and excessive commissions.
title: Apple slapped with highest-ever fine in EU over its fight with Spotify

description: In a surprising move on Monday, Chennai Super Kings skipper MS Dhoni made a rare social media post regarding his 'new role.' This mysterious announcement has ignited speculation among his fans, leaving them intrigued about the capacity in which he will be featured in the upcoming IPL. The post did not specify whether the reference to the 'new season' pertained to the IPL 2024 edition.
title: 'New role': Dhoni's cryptic post sets social media abuzz

description: The Reserve Bank on Monday barred IIFL Finance with immediate effect from sanctioning or disbursing gold loans after certain material supervisory concerns were observed in its gold loan portfolio. IIFL Finance can, however, continue to service its existing gold loan portfolio through the usual collection and recovery processes, the RBI said in a statement.
title: RBI bars IIFL Finance from sanctioning, disbursing gold loans

description: The Indian Coast Guard is strengthening its presence and assets in Lakshadweep and Minicoy islands by building a new jetty and commissioning a new naval base. They will also build an air enclave and deploy aircraft and choppers for surveillance in the Arabian Sea region. The ICG said it expects to commission the jetty "shortly".
title: After naval base in Minicoy, India building jetty in Androth

description: India's production-linked incentive (PLI) scheme for smartphones has provided incentives to Apple's contract manufacturers, Samsung, and Dixon Technologies. Some companies have not met production targets. Mobile phone exports have significantly increased. The scheme offers graded cashback incentives and has a revised duration and settlement timeline.
title: Government allocates over Rs 4,400 crore to Apple, Samsung
Ex-Gujarat Cong chief Arjun Modhwadia quits party

description: As the financial year ends, important deadlines in March 2024 include updating Aadhaar card, availing SBI FD schemes, and paying advance tax. Changes to the tax regime and SBI Card's minimum amount calculation rule are also in effect.
title: 9 money deadlines in March 2024 that you should not miss

description: BJP MP Upendra Singh Rawat opted out of Lok Sabha election after an obscene video involving him surfaced on social media. Rawat demanded investigation and lodged an FIR regarding the fake video.
title: Why BJP MP Upendra Singh Rawat has opted out of LS polls

description: Congress government in Himachal Pradesh confident of completing full term despite attempts to crush mandate with money power. CM Sukhu focuses on healthcare and education initiatives, indicating improbable change in leadership. BJP won Rajya Sabha seat with cross-voting by Congress MLAs.
title: 'Cong govt in HP safe': Vikramaditya meets party high command

description: Congress government in Himachal Pradesh confident of completing full term despite attempts to crush mandate with money power. CM Sukhu focuses on healthcare and education initiatives, indicating improbable change in leadership. BJP won Rajya Sabha seat with cross-voting by Congress MLAs.
title: 'Cong govt in HP safe': Vikramaditya meets party high command
'Rahul, Sonia sit with me, not you': Mann mocks Cong leader

description: Mighty impressed with Ravichandran Ashwin's range, aggressive mindset and relentless pursuit of wickets, senior England batter Joe Root has said that the veteran Indian off-spinner is a constant threat who hardly believes in the concept of wearing the opposition down. Ashwin, who recently went past the 500-wicket milestone in the traditional format becoming only the second Indian after Anil Kumble to do so, will play his 100th Test during the fifth match against England, starting on March 7 at Dharamshala.
title: Ashwin always trying to find ways to get you out: Root

description: The Supreme Court today ruled that lawmakers cannot claim immunity from prosecution in bribery cases. The court explained that the legal protection provided to MPs and MLAs under Articles 105 and 194 of the Constitution does not shield them in cases of accepting bribes for votes or speeches in the House.
title: SC strips immunity in bribery cases: What it means for MPs, MLAs

description: Gautam Gambhir, the mentor of Kolkata Knight Riders, said aid that IPL is 'toughest league in the world' and the tournament is a brilliant opportunity for youngsters to prove themselves on the biggest stage. The 17th edition of the IPL begins on March 22.
title: Gambhir's 'serious' message ahead of IPL 2024

description: OnePlus Watch 2 is now available for sale on Amazon and Flipkart. Samsung is offering a flat Rs 24,000 discount on its Watch5 Pro, making it almost the same price as OnePlus Watch 2. The Galaxy Watch5 Pro features a titanium case, 1.4" Super AMOLED display, up to 80 hours of battery life, and various other features.
title: Samsung's 'Rs 25,000 discount plan' on Amazon and Flipkart

description: NCW chief Rekha Sharma defends India's commitment to women's safety amidst accusations of defaming the country. She criticizes writers for vilifying India and emphasizes the importance of filing an FIR. Sharma refutes criticism and questions Sagarika Ghose's response to violence in West Bengal.
title: NCW chief's verbal spat with US-based writer grows ugly

description: At Unpacked 2024, Samsung introduced the Galaxy S24 series with a focus on Galaxy AI. The Galaxy S24 Ultra features a titanium frame, flat display, and Corning's Gorilla Glass Armor. It offers AI-powered features, on-device AI processing, and a 50MP 5x telephoto camera for impressive photography capabilities.
title: Samsung Galaxy S24 Ultra review: Where AI means ‘Accessible Intelligence’

description: Premier Li Qiang will no longer hold a news conference at the end of the National People's Congress, raising concerns about China's economic slowdown and the Communist Party's management of information. The cancellation ends a tradition that started in 1988. It was one of the rare occasions when a top Chinese leader takes questions from local and international media.
title: China breaks 30-year-old tradition, further closes itself off from global scrutiny

description: The Supreme Court on Monday granted the Aam Aadmi Party time till June 15, 2024 to vacate its offices at Rouse Avenue here after noting that the land was allotted to the Delhi High Court for expanding judicial infrastructure. A bench of Chief Justice D Y Chandrachud and Justices J B Pardiwala and Manoj Misra asked AAP to approach Land And Development Office for allotment of land for its offices.
title: SC orders AAP to vacate its Delhi HQ by June 15

description: Shehbaz Sharif becomes the 24th prime minister of Pakistan. He was sworn in by President Arif Alvi in Islamabad. Nawaz Sharif, Asif Ali Zardari, Bilawal Bhutto-Zardari, and Chief of Army Staff General Asim Munir attended the ceremony. The election was marred by accusations of a rigged vote.
title: Pakistan: Shehbaz Sharif takes oath as Prime Minister

description: Ten years after the mysterious disappearance of Malaysian flight MH-370, Malaysian PM Anwar Ibrahim expressed willingness to reopen the search if "compelling" evidence emerged. Australian PM Anthony Albanese regretted the ongoing grief. Transport minister Anthony Loke received a no-cure, no-fee proposal from Ocean Infinity for a fresh search.
title: 'If there is evidence ...': Malaysia may renew search for MH370

description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi hits back at Lalu Prasad and other opposition parties, saying 140 crore people of India are his family. He dedicates himself to public welfare as a sevak. BJP counters Lalu's attack by adding 'Modi ka parivar' to social media handles. The PM's remarks came a day after Lalu took a potshot at the PM for attacking dynasty politics as he "does not have a family himself".
title: 'Bharat my family': PM Modi take on oppn in T'gana

description: BJP leaders expressed solidarity with Prime Minister Modi adding "Modi ka parivar" to their social media handles,  a day after RJD president Lalu Prasad stirred a controversy with his remark "what can we do if Prime Minister Modi does not have a family of his own". The Prime Minister also responded to Lalu's attack and said "Mera Bharat, Mera Parivaar."
title: BJP leaders add 'Modi ka parivar' to their social media bios

description: The debate between club and country has long been a fixture in Indian cricket circles, particularly as each new Indian Premier League (IPL) season approaches. The tendency of players to show more interest in the IPL has frequently drawn criticism from experts and former players. Joining this chorus of critics is former India swing bowler, Praveen Kumar.
title: Iyer-Ishan controversy: 'Paisa kamao, par sirf IPL se nahi'

description: As the financial year ends, individuals seek tax-saving investment options. Tax-saving FDs offer deductions under Section 80C. Factors to consider before investing include optimal choice, expected changes in interest rates, and the opportunity to secure high interest rates now.
title: Why time to invest in tax-saving FDs is now; rates compared

description: The Supreme Court criticized Tamil Nadu Minister Udhayanidhi Stalin for his statement about 'eradicating Sanatan Dharma.' Justices reminded Stalin of the consequences of his remarks and pointed out that he had already abused his rights under Article 19(1)(a) and Article 25. The bench adjourned the matter to March 15. Stalin made the controversial statement during a conference in September 2023, stating that Sanatana Dharma is against social justice and equality.
title: SC pulls up Udhayanidhi Stalin over 'Sanatan Dharma' remark

description: Veteran TMC leader Tapas Roy hinted at quitting the Mamata Banerjee-led party due to displeasure over its functioning, handling of the Sandeshkhali issue, lack of support during his residence raid by the Enforcement Directorate (ED), and corruption allegations. He is expected to resign as TMC MLA today afternoon.
title: Senior TMC MLA Tapas Roy quits Mamata Banerjee-led party

description: Vivo V29e received a price cut. It features a diamond-cut crystal back panel, a 6.78-inch full HD+ display, and a Qualcomm Snapdragon 695 chipset. It runs on Android 13 with FunTouch OS 13. The main camera is 64MP and it has an 8MP secondary camera and a 50MP selfie camera. It has a 5000mAh battery.
title: Vivo V29e smartphone receives price cut in India: Details

description: PM Narendra Modi praised the Supreme Court's decision in the JMM bribery case on Monday, calling it a "great judgment" that will ensure "clean politics". The Supreme Court overturned the 1998 Narasimha Rao decision, ruling that "an MP or MLA cannot claim immunity from prosecution on a charge of bribery in connection with a vote/speech in Parliament/legislative assembly."
title: 'Great judgment': PM hails SC verdict in JMM bribery case

description: The Sunrisers Hyderabad franchise revealed on Monday that Pat Cummins, the World Cup-winning captain from Australia, will be leading their team in the upcoming Indian Premier League (IPL). Purchased for a staggering Rs 20.50 crore in last year's IPL auctions in December, the 30-year-old fast bowler became the second most expensive player in the history of the event.
title: Pat Cummins to lead Sunrisers in IPL 2024

description: Kuljeet Singh Sandhu of BJP won the senior deputy mayor election of Chandigarh Municipal Corporation. BJP kept its flock together and got the support of lone Shiromani Akali Dal councillor. A minor verbal altercation occurred before the polling due to officer selection.
title: BJP wins senior dy mayor post in C'garh Municipal Corporation

description: The rover's mission is to explore the lunar south pole, searching for water ice and other resources. This exploration is crucial for supporting Nasa's Artemis astronauts, including the first woman and the first person of color scheduled to walk on the moon in the Artemis 3 mission, targeted for 2026. Over a 100-day period, VIPER will traverse the lunar south pole region, creating detailed maps to locate water ice.
title: Nasa's ice-hunting VIPER Moon rover prepares for launch

description: India's economy recorded its swiftest expansion in eighteen months in the last quarter of 2023, propelled by vigorous manufacturing and construction activities, registering a growth rate of 8.4%, surpassing economists' consensus estimate of 6.6%.
title: Moody’s raises India's 2024 GDP forecast sharply
Jio-Disney merger: Plans offer free JioCinema subscription, more

description: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) has claimed that 'Pakistan Zindabad' slogans were raised outside the Vidhan Souda, based on a private lab report. Karnataka Home Minister G Parameshwara emphasized that the government will take action based on the forensic report of the Home Department. The BJP has accused the Congress of spreading false news and demanded an apology.
title: 'Pak Zindabad' slogans: K'taka minister dismisses BJP claims

description: The hosts secured a decisive victory over England in the fourth Test, establishing an insurmountable 3-1 lead in the series. This rendered the upcoming match in Dharamsala significant solely for its implications on the World Test Championship points. Had the series been poised at 2-1 or 2-2 going into the fifth Test, England would have harbored optimism, particularly in conditions reminiscent of climate back home, amidst the chilly, rainy setting of Dharamsala.
title: 5th Test: Chilly, rainy Dharamsala awaits India & England

description: KL Rahul, recovering from quadriceps injury, is rehabilitating at BCCI's National Cricket Academy. He aims to prove his worth in IPL and secure his place in India's T20 World Cup team.
title: KL Rahul on track to be fit for IPL

description: Manisha Rani wins Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa 11. Ankita Lokhande's possessiveness towards her husband Vicky Jain becomes the subject of speculation. Ankita and Vicky met Manisha Rani at Farah Khan's party and congratulated her for the win. While sharing the video, Manisha made a sly remark hinting at Ankita's possessiveness for Vicky.
title: Ankita, Vicky congratulate Manisha for winning Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa

description: The National Commission for Protection of Child Rights (NCPCR) has urged the government to take action against the Ullu App for disseminating obscene material to minors. The app targets school children with explicit content, violating the POCSO Act and lacking age verification systems.
title: 'Obscene content': NPCR complains to IT min against Ullu app

description: The seven-judge SC bench, in its unanimous verdict, said the 1998 ruling was paradoxical as it protected bribe taking MPs who vote in consideration of it but allowed prosecution of those who did not vote. "An MP or MLA can't claim immunity from prosecution on a charge of bribery in connection with the vote/speech in the Parliament/legislative assembly," the bench headed by CJI DY Chandrachud said.
title: Vote-for-bribe: SC says no immunity for MPs & MLAs, overrules 1998 Narasimha Rao verdict

description: Devon Conway sustained the injury during the second T20I against Australia and had to leave the field for an X-ray, which fortunately ruled out any obvious fracture. However, after further scans and consultations with specialists, New Zealand Cricket (NZC) decided that surgery was necessary for Conway, with an anticipated recovery time of at least eight weeks.
title: CSK lose their star batsman ahead of IPL 2024

description: Nine Bangladeshi nationals have been arrested by the Odisha Police for illegally entering the Jagannath Temple in Puri. The individuals were detained after a complaint was received about the entry of non-Hindu individuals from Bangladesh.
title: 9 B'deshi nat'ls held for illegally entering Jagannath temple

description: NIA takes over investigation of Rameshwaram Cafe blast in Bengaluru. Ongoing police investigation considers jealousy factor. NSG arrives. Bengaluru residents urged not to panic or worry. Karnataka home minister assures suspect's arrest.
title: Bengaluru cafe blast probe handed over to NIA

description: Akon performed at Anant Ambani and Radhika Merchant's pre-wedding celebrations. After hitting the big stage for a  musical performance, the singer returned with an encore performance of his hit song 'Chammak Challo' from 'Ra.One' and got Shah Rukh Khan, Salman Khan, Suhana Khan and Gauri Khan to join him on stage and dance to his hit tune.
title: Anant, Radhika's after-party: Akon gets SRK, Salman dancing

description: Rishabh Pant is set to return to the Indian Premier League after a car crash more than a year ago, which required multiple surgeries and long rehab. Delhi Capitals' Director of Cricket, Sourav Ganguly, revealed that Pant will receive fitness clearance from the NCA on March 5, and the franchise will take a cautious approach considering his long career ahead.
title: Watch: Rishabh Pant playing marbles in neighbourhood

description: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal will attend the Enforcement Directorate hearing via video conferencing after receiving the illegal summons. AAP announced his reply and requested a date after March 12, as he failed to appear on previous occasions.
title: After 8th summons, Kejriwal agrees to appear before ED

description: A scrapped Airbus A-319 hit a lamp post during transport, causing chaos on the road. The driver fled, leaving the aircraft parked. Accidents occurred, including one involving a cyclist. The incident highlights tensions in the region. Jet fuel sales have increased, while diesel demand remains slow. The government aims to improve flight punctuality and address infrastructure and air traffic issues.
title: Kolkata: Airbus A-319 hits lamp post, causes traffic mayhem

description: Radhika Gupta, an investor on Shark Tank India Season 3, discusses the challenges of being an entrepreneur or angel investor. She mentions the slow path to making money, the load women take on, advantages of being a woman, trolls women face, and a skincare brand's 'financial indiscipline'. Gupta's career reflects her passion for finance and entrepreneurship.
title: Shark Radhika reveals why entrepreneurship slowest way of earning

description: Nikki Haley emerges victorious in the Republican primary in the District of Columbia, interrupting Donald Trump's dominance. She offers an alternative to Trump and aims to prevent Joe Biden from serving a second term. Haley, the only remaining challenger to Donald Trump in the race, won 62.9% of the vote, versus 33.2% captured by the former president.
title: Nikki Haley wins Republican primary in Washington DC

description: Two individuals have been arrested in connection with the murder of Nafe Singh Rathee, the chief of Haryana's INLD. The suspects, believed to have ties to the UK-based Kapil Sangwan gang, were arrested in a joint operation by the police in Goa. Efforts are underway to locate two other individuals involved in the shooting.
title: INLD chief Nafe Singh murder: 2 shooters nabbed from Goa

description: Shoaib Ibrahim reacts to Manisha Rani winning Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa 11, and expresses gratitude to Allah for reaching the top 5. Dipika Kakar gets emotional as Shoaib couldn't fulfil her wish to see him lift the trophy. They plan to visit Dubai with their son Ruhaan. Take a look at what Dipika Kakar had to say.
title: Shoaib reacts to Manisha Rani lifting Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa 11 trophy

description: OnePlus Watch 2 is a feature-packed smartwatch running Google’s Wear OS. It competes with Samsung Galaxy Watch6 and Apple Watch SE 2. With a Sapphire Crystal display and dual chipset design, it offers 100 hours of battery life and supports a wide range of health-tracking options and sports modes.
title: OnePlus’ most-expensive smartwatch goes on sale today: Details

description: Indian edtech major Byju's is facing a financial controversy as a US court hearing approaches to determine the whereabouts of $533 million invested in an American hedge fund. Byju's employees have also reported salary delays due to a dispute with investors over funds raised through a recent rights issue.
title: We don't have money to pay salaries to employees: Byju's

description: India aims to challenge semiconductor manufacturing dominance, attracting major players with incentives. It leverages design talent and becomes an indispensable partner for Western economies. The semiconductor value chain and manufacturing capability create economic growth and investment opportunities. India's leadership in semiconductor manufacturing is a catalyst for global technology development.
title: '5-yr target' set to cut dominance of China, others in chip manufacturing

description: Tech giants like TCS, Infosys, Google, HCLTech, Wipro, Cognizant, Amazon, Meta, IBM, and Dell are requiring employees to work from the office for effective collaboration, potential promotion, or job loss for non-compliance. These policies indicate a trend among tech companies to reintroduce office work, often citing reasons such as improved collaboration, productivity, and company culture.
title: 10 comp that asked employees to work from office at least 3 days a week

description: Investigation reveals a Rs 11,793 crore human hair smuggling racket involving money laundering from Hyderabad to Mizoram and Myanmar. Cash is deposited and routed through multiple accounts. Smuggling of Indian hair illegally to China is exposed. Chargesheet filed against 18 individuals.
title: Hyd: Probe unearths money trail of Rs 11k cr human hair racket
